What makes virtual disks any different from actual hard drives? We'll examine this question by creating a virtual disk from scratch.

What does your operating system think a disk drive is? I have a 320 GB SATA drive in my computer which is represented in Linux as the file /dev/sda. Using file, stat and fdisk we'll see what Linux thinks the /dev/sda file is.

The term block is generally interchangeable with the term sector. The only difference in their meaning is contextual. It's common usage to say block when referring to the data being referenced and to use sector when speaking about disk geometry. Officially the term data block was defined by ANSI ASC X3 in ANSI X3.221-199x - AT Attachment Interface for Disk Drives (ATA-1)
